structure.unit: SCHOOL EMPLOYEES -- TEACHERS' RETIREMENT AND TENURE

law.catch_line: Leave for jury duty for teachers and state employees.

text.section: Any teacher or state employee, except employees subject to the provisions of KRS Chapter 18A, who serves on a jury in any duly constituted local, state, or federal court shall be granted leave with full compensation, less any compensation received as jury pay, for the period of his actual jury service, which leave shall be in addition to all other leave to which the teacher or state employee may be entitled.

Any state employee who is subject to the provisions of KRS Chapter 18A and who serves on a jury in any duly constituted local, state, or federal court shall be granted leave with full compensation for the period of his actual jury service, which shall be in addition to all other leave to which the employee may be entitled.

law.history: Repealed and reenacted 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. V, sec. 476, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 269, sec. 8, effective June 17, 1978. -- Created 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 97, sec. 1.
